wikipedia_page.main: Thomas Owen Potter (10 September 1844 – 27 April 1909) was an English cricketer active in 1866 who played for Lancashire. He was born in Calcutta and died in Hoylake. He appeared in one first-class match and scored 39 runs with a highest score of 39.

response: *Thomas Potter (Universalist) (1689–1777), one founder of the Universalist Church in America
*Thomas Potter (died 1759) (1718–1759), British MP for Aylesbury, Okehampton and St Germans
*Thomas Potter (mayor) (1774–1845), mayor of Manchester, England, father of Thomas Bayley Potter
*Thomas Potter (industrialist) (1745–1811), Scottish-born Danish industrialist and merchant
